Description: **Cloudflare zones** are assessed for **Hotlink Protection** (Scrape Shield) configuration by checking if it is enabled to prevent other websites from directly linking to **images and media**, consuming bandwidth without authorization.
Risk:
Without **Hotlink Protection**, external websites can embed your media directly.
- **Confidentiality**: content may be used without proper attribution or permission
- **Integrity**: unauthorized use of media may misrepresent your brand
- **Availability**: bandwidth theft increases costs and may degrade performance

Code.Other:
1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and select your account and domain
2. Go to Scrape Shield (or Security > Settings in newer UI)
3. Scroll to Hotlink Protection
4. Toggle the setting to On
5. Review allowed referrers if legitimate integrations require access

Recommendation.Text:
Enable **Hotlink Protection** to prevent unauthorized embedding of your media.
- Blocks requests to images when HTTP referer does not match your domain
- Reduces bandwidth costs from unauthorized embedding
- Review allowed referrers for legitimate integrations
- Part of the Scrape Shield feature set for comprehensive protection

Notes: Hotlink Protection blocks requests to images when the HTTP referer does not match your domain. May need configuration for legitimate third-party embedding use cases.
